case_vignette: An 8-year-old male presents with 1 week of itchy blisters on the ears. He just recently returned from spring break with his family. He denies using any particular products on the ears before the rash. He says that this has occurred yearly for the last several years, always around the same time. He denies proximal muscle weakness. He denies flaking in the scalp.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

assistant

Herpes Zoster (Shingles) or more likely, Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV) infection, given the recurrent nature and itchy blisters.

assistant

The final diagnosis is Herpes Simplex Virus infection of the ear, but given the yearly recurrence, the most likely diagnosis is Herpes Simplex Virus infection of the ear due to a condition called Herpetic Whitlow or possibly a condition called Herpes Simplex Virus infection of the auricle.
